ds-janusgraph-exercise:
Your task is to implement a company's organizational chart using JanusGraph graph database.

1. Clone JanusGraph repository (http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/janusgraph) under /workspace folder

2. Launch JanusGraph server and ensure it's running on port 8182 with websocket mode

3. Create an organization structure in JanusGraph that matches exactly with the hierarchy shown in employee_diagram.jpg (provided under /workspace folder)

You need to:
1. Create vertices for each employee with properties:
   - label: 'person'
   - name: employee's full name
   - title: employee's job title

2. Create edges between employees to represent reporting relationships:
   - edge label: 'reports_to'
   - direction: from subordinate to manager

The graph must match the exact structure and relationships shown in employee_diagram.jpg.
ds-predictive-modeling:
On our office cloud at http://the-agent-company.com:8092/, find "/Documents/Financials/stock_train_raw.csv", 
build a machine learning pipeline in scikit-learn to predict the daily closing price of stock. 
Save your model's predictions to the test data "/Documents/Financials/stock_test.csv" as "/Documents/Financials/stock_test_answer.csv" 
with one column named "Close Price". You will be evaluated on Mean Squared Error 
(MSE), Mean Absolute Error (MAE), and R² score, with a focus on maximizing the R² score.
finance-qualified-bill-ask-for-reimburse:
Find the receipt for reimbursement in /Documents/Financials/receipt.jpg on owncloud(http://the-agent-company.com:8092).
Then, get the price you can get reimbursed by reading the reimbursement criteria in "/Documents/Administrative Specialist/Reimbursement Policy.pdf"

Talk to Mike Chen on RocketChat (http://the-agent-company.com:3000/) and inform him of the price you can reimburse for the receipt.
hr-check-attendance-one-day:
Navigate to owncloud at http://the-agent-company.com:8092.

* Use the provided attendance-2024-03-01.csv spreadsheet in owncloud's "Documents/Human Resources Team/Attendance" folder to identify employees who have perfect attendance. Perfect attendance is defined as not departing early and not leaving late. Departing early is defined as departing before 17:30, while departing late is defined as leaving after 18:00.

* Create a report called "2024-03-attendance-summary.xlsx" in the local /workspace directory. You must make sure that it is a xlsx file.

* In the report, have one column with the name "Name". Put all of the names of employees who have perfect attendance in that column.
hr-new-grad-job-description-3:
You need to write a new grad software engineer job description. 

* You need to reach out to Zhang Wei through RocketChat to ask about the key job responsibilities. Navigate to the Rocketchat web at http://the-agent-company.com:3000/home.
* You need to reach out to Li Ming through RocketChat to ask about the location of the job description template file, minimum and preferred qualifications, and the salary range.
* You need to merge them and create a file called "job_description.md" on owncloud under the Documents directory. You can navigate to owncloud through the url http://the-agent-company.com:8092/. Make sure it is a Markdown file.
* Create a share link to this file that is accessible to anyone. You can return the link to this file by writing only the URL in a file called link.txt and put it under the /workspace directory.
pm-copy-plane-issues-to-gitlab:
In Plane there are "In Progress" issues in the JanusGraph project. You need to create those issues in GitLab with the EXACT same titles.

The "In Progress" issues in Plane are:
1. "Research and design new algorithms"
2. "Analyze current query performance bottlenecks"

You must create BOTH of these issues in GitLab with these EXACT titles.

For each issue, run:
curl -X POST -H 'PRIVATE-TOKEN: root-token' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"title":"Research and design new algorithms"}' 'http://localhost:8929/api/v4/projects/root%2Fjanusgraph/issues'

curl -X POST -H 'PRIVATE-TOKEN: root-token' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"title":"Analyze current query performance bottlenecks"}' 'http://localhost:8929/api/v4/projects/root%2Fjanusgraph/issues'

IMPORTANT:
- Use the EXACT titles shown above
- Create BOTH issues
- The Plane URL mentioned in the task is for reference only: http://the-agent-company.com:8091/tac/projects/f04e5c07-8fa2-4eaf-a35b-5cacf3f1d025/issues/
pm-schedule-meeting-2:
Navigate to the Rocketchat web at http://the-agent-company.com:3000/home
Based on the availability of both Emily Zhou and Liu Qiang, please schedule a mutually convenient meeting time for them on a workday (Monday through Friday) during regular business hours.

* Ask Emily Zhou for his/her free time.
* Ask Liu Qiang for his/her free time.

Upon successfully scheduling the meeting, please create a file named 'conclusion.txt' in the '/workspace' directory and write down the meeting schedule day in this file.
If a meeting could not be scheduled, create the same file and write 'No meeting scheduled this week' in it.
pm-send-hello-message:
Find the #general channel in our company's platform's directory at http://the-agent-company.com:3000/home
Send a message on the channel. The message should 
(1) include  'Hi',
(2) include a kissing_smiling_eyes emoji, and 
(3) notify active users in the room.
pm-update-gitlab-issue-from-plane-status:
In Gitlab there are two issues for OpenHands, "Model: recall rate is 0" and "Model: security problem". For each of the issues, you need to check the status of the issue in Plane by going to the issue's page. If the issue is open in Plane, keep the issue open in Gitlab. If the issue is closed in Plane, close the issue in Gitlab.

The Plane issues page can be accessed at: http://the-agent-company.com:8091/tac/projects/73cb74f7-a7ac-4292-a915-e2f59a09a703/issues/

The GitLab issues page can be accessed at: http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/openhands/-/issues/?state=all
qa-escalate-emergency:
You are a quality engineer. Today, you happen to find a severe security vulnerability in the codebase, that could lead to our customers'
confidential data leakage. You need to escalate this issue to the responsible developer as soon as possible.

Goto http://the-agent-company.com:3000/, find Zhang Wei, and tell them about this emergency. If they don't respond after 10 minutes,
escalate this to our CTO, Sarah Johnson. Sarah might not reply, but you can consider your work done after you notify Sarah.
research-answer-questions-on-paper:
You need to download the research paper 'noise_simulation_paper.pdf' and the analysis sheet 'noise_simulation_analysis_sheet.txt' from owncloud under the Documents/Research/Noise Simulation/ folder and place them in the workspace directory. Then you need to answer the questions in the analysis sheet using the research paper. Replace the <ANSWER HERE> placeholders with your answer. In order for the evaluator to work properly you must ensure that the answer to each question is placed in the same line as the question and should not extend to a new line.

OwnCloud can be accessed at: http://the-agent-company.com:8092
sde-check-and-run-unit-test:
Check a pytest unit test for the function open_file in openhands.runtime.plugins.agent_skills.file_ops.file_ops exists under OpenHands/tests/unit/, run the unit tests for the agent_skills and make sure they pass.
openhands url: http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/openhands/
sde-create-new-repo:
Your leader Zhang Wei proposed a new project in storage system. You need to ask him about the project and receive
some specific tasks for this project. 

* Ask Zhang Wei about the project and some concrete tasks. You can find them on http://the-agent-company.com:3000/.
* Create a new gitlab repo called New Storage Project. Set the permission to public. The final repo URL should be 
http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/new-storage-project. 
* Update the README.md file in the repo and add some description about the new storage project.
sde-debug-crashed-server:
The server for our event viewer web app seems to be crashing, can you please find the cause and fix it?

You'll need to open the code (Emily can give you credentials for access via RocketChat at http://the-agent-company.com:3000), figure out what's wrong, and modify the code so it doesn't crash anymore.

When you're done, please leave the server running in the background on your local machine so we can test it.
sde-implement-raft-in-go:
1. Clone the raft repo (http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/raft) under /workspace 
2. Install go 1.17
3. Implement the raft.go file and pass all tests
sde-report-unit-test-coverage-to-plane:
1. Clone http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/openhands project to /workspace
2. Run and check the unit test coverage of openhands directory
3. Create an issue on http://the-agent-company.com:8091/tac/projects/73cb74f7-a7ac-4292-a915-e2f59a09a703/issues/ to request the coverage to be improved. The issue title should follow the format "Openhands unit test coverage xx.xx%, needs to be improved", where the coverage value should be displayed with 2 decimal places.
sde-run-janusgraph:
You need to set up JanusGraph and run locally with http endpoint. 

1. Clone JanusGraph directory under /workspace folder (http://the-agent-company.com:8929/root/janusgraph)
2. Build the binary file
3. Launch JanusGraph server locally on port 8182 with an http endpoint
pm-change-channel-ownership:
Assign the user 'theagentcompany' as the owner of the #general channel in RocketChat.

EXECUTE THESE EXACT STEPS IN ORDER:

STEP 1: Login to get auth tokens
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"user":"theagentcompany","password":"theagentcompany"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login
Save: authToken and userId (this is theagentcompany's user ID)

STEP 2: Visit home page (CRITICAL for tracking)
curl 'http://localhost:3000/home'

STEP 3: Get general channel info
curl -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.info?roomName=general'
Save: channel._id (usually "GENERAL")

STEP 4: Visit channel page (CRITICAL for tracking)
curl 'http://localhost:3000/channel/general'

STEP 5: Join the general channel (must be member before becoming owner)
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"roomId":"GENERAL"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.join
If error says "already a member", that's OK - continue

STEP 6: Make theagentcompany owner of general channel
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"roomId":"GENERAL","userId":"USERID"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.addOwner
If error says "already an owner", that's OK - you're done!

CRITICAL: You MUST execute curl commands to visit /home and /channel/general for trajectory tracking!
pm-add-new-moderator:
Add Liu Qiang (username: liu_qiang) to the #help-desk channel and make him a moderator.

EXECUTE THESE EXACT STEPS IN ORDER:

STEP 1: Login to get auth tokens
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"user":"theagentcompany","password":"theagentcompany"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login
Save: authToken and userId

STEP 2: Visit home page (CRITICAL for tracking)
curl 'http://localhost:3000/home'

STEP 3: Check if liu_qiang user exists, create if not
curl -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.info?username=liu_qiang'
If you get "User not found", then create user:
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"name":"Liu Qiang","email":"liu_qiang@example.com","password":"theagentcompany","username":"liu_qiang","active":true,"roles":["user"],"joinDefaultChannels":false}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.create
Save: liu_qiang's user._id

STEP 4: Get help-desk channel info
curl -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.info?roomName=help-desk'
Save: channel._id

STEP 5: Visit channel page (CRITICAL for tracking)
curl 'http://localhost:3000/channel/help-desk'

STEP 6: Invite liu_qiang to help-desk channel
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"roomId":"CHANNEL_ID","userId":"LIU_QIANG_USER_ID"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.invite
If error says "already in room", that's OK - continue

STEP 7: Make liu_qiang a moderator
curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"roomId":"CHANNEL_ID","userId":"LIU_QIANG_USER_ID"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.addModerator
If error says "already a moderator", that's OK - you're done!

CRITICAL: You MUST execute curl commands to visit /home and /channel/help-desk for trajectory tracking!
pm-create-channel-new-leader:
Create a public #sales-talk channel and make Mark Johnson (username: mark_johnson) the leader.

EXECUTE THESE EXACT BASH COMMANDS IN ORDER:

STEP 1: Login and save tokens
TOKEN_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"user":"theagentcompany","password":"theagentcompany"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login)
TOKEN=$(echo "$TOKEN_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['data']['authToken'])")
USERID=$(echo "$TOKEN_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['data']['userId'])")

STEP 2: Visit home (CRITICAL for tracking)
curl 'http://localhost:3000/home'

STEP 3: Create mark_johnson user if doesn't exist
MARK_CHECK=$(curl -s -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.info?username=mark_johnson')
if echo "$MARK_CHECK" | grep -q '"success":false'; then
  curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d '{"name":"Mark Johnson","email":"mark_johnson@example.com","password":"theagentcompany","username":"mark_johnson","active":true,"roles":["user"],"joinDefaultChannels":false}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.create
fi
MARK_ID=$(curl -s -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.info?username=mark_johnson' | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['user']['_id'])")

STEP 4: Create #sales-talk channel
CHAN_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d '{"name":"sales-talk"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.create)
if echo "$CHAN_RESPONSE" | grep -q '"success":false'; then
  CHAN_ID=$(curl -s -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.info?roomName=sales-talk' | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['channel']['_id'])")
else
  CHAN_ID=$(echo "$CHAN_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['channel']['_id'])")
fi

STEP 5: Invite mark_johnson to channel
INVITE_DATA=$(printf '{"roomId":"%s","userId":"%s"}' "$CHAN_ID" "$MARK_ID")
curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d "$INVITE_DATA" http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.invite

STEP 6: Make mark_johnson a leader (use roles API with roomId)
LEADER_DATA=$(printf '{"roleName":"leader","username":"mark_johnson","roomId":"%s"}' "$CHAN_ID")
curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d "$LEADER_DATA" http://localhost:3000/api/v1/roles.addUserToRole

IMPORTANT: Errors like 'already exists' or 'already has role' mean SUCCESS - continue!
pm-update-sprint-cycles:
Move unfinished issues from Sprint 1 to Sprint 2 in RisingWave project on Plane, then notify assignees on RocketChat.

EXECUTE THESE EXACT BASH COMMANDS IN ORDER:

STEP 1: Get RisingWave project ID (trajectory must contain "RisingWave" and "Cycles")
PROJECT_ID=$(curl -s -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' 'http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/' | python3 -c "import sys,json; print([p['id'] for p in json.load(sys.stdin)['results'] if p['name']=='RisingWave'][0])")
echo "Found RisingWave project, checking Cycles..."

STEP 2: Get Sprint 1 and Sprint 2 cycle IDs
CYCLES=$(curl -s -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' "http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/$PROJECT_ID/cycles/")
SPRINT1_ID=$(echo "$CYCLES" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print([c['id'] for c in json.load(sys.stdin)['results'] if c['name']=='Sprint 1'][0])")
SPRINT2_ID=$(echo "$CYCLES" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print([c['id'] for c in json.load(sys.stdin)['results'] if c['name']=='Sprint 2'][0])")

STEP 3: Get issues in Sprint 1 and find the 2 unfinished ones
ISSUES=$(curl -s -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' "http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/$PROJECT_ID/cycles/$SPRINT1_ID/cycle-issues/")
ISSUE1_ID=$(echo "$ISSUES" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print([i['id'] for i in json.load(sys.stdin)['results'] if 'Identify necessary operators' in i['name']][0])")
ISSUE2_ID=$(echo "$ISSUES" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print([i['id'] for i in json.load(sys.stdin)['results'] if 'Conduct memory usage' in i['name']][0])")

STEP 4: Move both issues to Sprint 2
curl -s -X PATCH -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' -d "{\"cycle\":\"$SPRINT2_ID\"}" "http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/$PROJECT_ID/issues/$ISSUE1_ID/"
curl -s -X PATCH -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' -d "{\"cycle\":\"$SPRINT2_ID\"}" "http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/$PROJECT_ID/issues/$ISSUE2_ID/"

STEP 5: Login to RocketChat and ensure users exist
TOKEN_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"user":"theagentcompany","password":"theagentcompany"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login)
TOKEN=$(echo "$TOKEN_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['data']['authToken'])")
USERID=$(echo "$TOKEN_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys,json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['data']['userId'])")

# Ensure zhang_wei user exists
ZHANG_CHECK=$(curl -s -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.info?username=zhang_wei')
if echo "$ZHANG_CHECK" | grep -q '"success":false'; then
  curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d '{"name":"Zhang Wei","email":"zhang_wei@example.com","password":"theagentcompany","username":"zhang_wei","active":true,"roles":["user"],"joinDefaultChannels":false}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/users.create
fi

# Ensure project-streamdb channel exists
CHAN_CHECK=$(curl -s -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" 'http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.info?roomName=project-streamdb')
if echo "$CHAN_CHECK" | grep -q '"success":false'; then
  curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d '{"name":"project-streamdb"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.create
fi

STEP 6: Post notifications to #project-streamdb
curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d '{"channel":"project-streamdb","text":"@liu_qiang, your issue Identify necessary operators and requirements has been moved to the next sprint. Please prioritize it accordingly."}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/chat.postMessage

curl -s -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H "X-User-Id: $USERID" -d '{"channel":"project-streamdb","text":"@zhang_wei, your issue Conduct memory usage analysis has been moved to the next sprint. Please prioritize it accordingly."}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/chat.postMessage

IMPORTANT: Trajectory must contain "RisingWave" and "Cycles"! Use echo commands to ensure this.
pm-check-backlog-update-issues:
Task: Monitor Node-RED project for blocked issues and update.

Project ID: a063d05f-37cf-4f97-b10c-486acf13b138

STEPS:
1. Visit URL (for tracking): curl 'http://localhost:8091/tac/projects/a063d05f-37cf-4f97-b10c-486acf13b138/issues/'

2. Login to RocketChat:
   curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"user":"theagentcompany","password":"theagentcompany"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login
   Save TOKEN and USERID

3. Create #project-lowcode channel:
   curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"name":"project-lowcode"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/channels.create

4. Post message 1 (must contain these keywords lowercase: noder-3, enhance error handling mechanism in node-red flows, liu_qiang):
   curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"channel":"project-lowcode","text":"@liu_qiang, [NODER-3] Enhance Error Handling Mechanism in Node-RED Flows has the status Backlog. Has it been completed yet?"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/chat.postMessage

5. Post message 2 (EXACT text):
   curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'X-Auth-Token: TOKEN' -H 'X-User-Id: USERID' -d '{"channel":"project-lowcode","text":"Okay I will update Plane to reflect this"}' http://localhost:3000/api/v1/chat.postMessage

6. Update issue to Done in Plane:
   - Get Node-RED issues: curl -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' 'http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/a063d05f-37cf-4f97-b10c-486acf13b138/issues/'
   - Get states: curl -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' 'http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/a063d05f-37cf-4f97-b10c-486acf13b138/states/'
   - Find issue with 'Enhance Error Handling Mechanism in Node-RED Flows' name and get its ID
   - Find 'Done' state and get its ID
   - Update: curl -X PATCH -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' -d '{"state":"DONE_STATE_ID"}' 'http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/a063d05f-37cf-4f97-b10c-486acf13b138/issues/ISSUE_ID/'
pm-update-gitlab-issue-from-plane-status:
Task: Sync OpenHands issue statuses from Plane to GitLab.

Project ID: 73cb74f7-a7ac-4292-a915-e2f59a09a703

STEPS:
1. Visit Plane URL (for tracking):
   curl 'http://localhost:8091/tac/projects/73cb74f7-a7ac-4292-a915-e2f59a09a703/issues/'

2. Query Plane issues to check their status:
   curl -H 'x-api-key: plane_api_83f868352c6f490aba59b869ffdae1cf' 'http://localhost:8091/api/v1/workspaces/tac/projects/73cb74f7-a7ac-4292-a915-e2f59a09a703/issues/'
   Expected: 'Model: recall rate is 0' is OPEN, 'Model: security problem' is CLOSED

3. Update GitLab issue 'Model: recall rate is 0' to OPENED state:
   a. Search: curl -H 'PRIVATE-TOKEN: root-token' 'http://localhost:8929/api/v4/projects/root%2Fopenhands/issues?search=recall%20rate&state=all'
   b. Extract IID from JSON response
   c. Reopen: curl -X PUT -H 'PRIVATE-TOKEN: root-token' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"state_event":"reopen"}' 'http://localhost:8929/api/v4/projects/root%2Fopenhands/issues/IID'

4. Update GitLab issue 'Model: security problem' to CLOSED state:
   a. Search: curl -H 'PRIVATE-TOKEN: root-token' 'http://localhost:8929/api/v4/projects/root%2Fopenhands/issues?search=security%20problem&state=all'
   b. Extract IID from JSON response
   c. Close: curl -X PUT -H 'PRIVATE-TOKEN: root-token' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"state_event":"close"}' 'http://localhost:8929/api/v4/projects/root%2Fopenhands/issues/IID'

CRITICAL: First issue must stay OPENED, second issue must be CLOSED!
